introduction: Mums-to-be often feel guilty about the food they crave in pregnancy. Georgie and Phil discuss this a

vocabulary.definition: strong desire for some particular food
vocabulary.example: During pregnancy, many women experience cravings for unusual food combinations.

vocabulary.definition: an occasion where you do something in an extreme way, like eating or drinking too much
vocabulary.example: After a stressful day, she had a binge on junk food.

vocabulary.definition: not working properly, out of control
vocabulary.example: The computer system went haywire and crashed during the presentation.

vocabulary.definition: criticizing or blaming oneself as a form of punishment
vocabulary.example: She tends to engage in self-punishment whenever she makes a mistake.

vocabulary.definition: a group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words
vocabulary.example: Learning idioms in a new language can be challenging but rewarding.

vocabulary.definition: substances that provide nourishment essential for growth and the maintenance of life
vocabulary.example: Fruits and vegetables are rich in nutrients that are beneficial for overall health.
